http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: term granularity
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001221
definition: Term granularity relates an entity to an instance of granularity that describes the level of granularity that a term belongs to. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: duration
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000951
definition: A measure of the magnitude of the time region in which the process occurs. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: condition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000090
definition: A condition is an information content entity that is about the portion of reality under which something occurs or is valid. The condition is limited by its scope and may have preconditions. It restricts the possible realizations. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.label: portion of mixed material
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.name: AFM_0001038
definition: An portion of mixed material is a material entity that consists of different kinds of grains if you inspect it at a higher level of granularity. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/CHMO_0000.label: portion of material
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/CHMO_0000.name: CHMO_0000993
definition: An independent material continuant that is self-connected and retains its identity over time. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.label: ingredient role
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.name: AFRL_0000249
definition: Ingredient is a role of material that is used in a material combining process to produce a new material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_00000.label: information content entity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_00000.name: IAO_0000030
definition: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing. [IAO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: material entity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000040
definition: A material entity is an independent continuant that has some portion of matter as proper or improper continuant part. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: collection
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000166
definition: An aggregation of data items for a purpose. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: item
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000167
definition: An item is an individual member of some collection. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: process
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000015
definition: p is a process if p is an occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t, p specifically depends on some material entity at t. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.label: material
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.name: AFM_0000275
definition: A material entity that occupies space and possesses a rest mass. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: log
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000900
definition: A log is a list of related log entries. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/RO_000257.label: system
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/RO_000257.name: RO_0002577
definition: A material entity consisting of multiple components that are causally integrated. [RO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: port
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000847
definition: Connection point of a system through which flows material, energy or information. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: capability
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001103
definition: A capability is a proposition that is about a function, role or quality realized under given conditions. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: container
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000407
definition: A device that has the function to contain material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: classification
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000916
definition: A classification is a proposition that categorizes things into classes or collections of things differentiated by some criteria. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: proposition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000991
definition: A proposition is an information content entity that is statement or assertion that has a truth value. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: process boundary
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000035
definition: p is a process boundary if p is a temporal part of a process and p has no proper temporal parts. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: function
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000034
definition: A function is a disposition that exists in virtue of the bearer’s physical make-up and this physical make-up is something the bearer possesses because it came into being, either through evolution (in the case of natural biological entities) or through intentional design (in the case of artifacts), in order to realize processes of a certain sort. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: quality process profile
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0003281
definition: A quality process profile is a process profile that covers the change of a quality of an independent continuant that is participant of the profiles process. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: quality
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000019
definition: A quality is a specifically dependent continuant that, in contrast to roles and dispositions, does not require any further process in order to be realized. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00001.label: process profile
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00001.name: BFO_0000144
definition: B is a process profile if there is some process c such that b is process profile of c. B is process profile of c holds when b is a proper occurrent part of c and there is some proper occurrent part d of c which has no parts in common with b and is mutually dependent on b and is such that b, c and d occupy the same temporal region. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: range
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000021
definition: A range is an interval of values with a lower and/or upper limit. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: description
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000922
definition: A description is a proposition about an existing entity. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: specification
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000957
definition: A specification is a proposition about the intended purpose or design of an entity. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: identifier
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000917
definition: An identifier is a name that identifies (that is, labels the identity of) either a unique object or a unique class of objects, where the "object" or class may be an idea, physical [countable] object (or class thereof), or physical [uncountable] substance (or class thereof). [Wikipedia]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: occurrent
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000003
definition: An occurrent is an entity that unfolds itself in time or it is the instantaneous boundary of such an entity (for example a beginning or an ending) or it is a temporal or spatiotemporal region which such an entity occupies a temporal region or occupies a spatiotemporal region. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: facet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000923
definition: A facet is a partial information that contains an aspect of some information content entity or parts of it when participating in some process. The facet abstracts of the concrete representation of this aspect of information. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.label: contextual role
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.name: AFRL_0000166
definition: A contextual role is a representation of a specific interpretation of the information content object or of the circumstances that the information content object is referencing to. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: representation form
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000992
definition: A representation form is a type of information content entity that represents an entity in a certain way. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.label: energy
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/mat.name: AFM_0000880
definition: Energy must be transferred to an object in order to perform work on, or to heat the object. It can be converted in form, but not created or destroyed. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: code
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000050
definition: An entry in a list of controlled symbols denoting a classification. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: index
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000928
definition: A facet that represents some strictly ordered key in an associative array or the position of a member in a list. [Allotrope]

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Conc.label: Concept
http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Conc.name: Concept
definition: An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: definition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001561
definition: A definition is a proposition that succinctly characterizes an entity. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: function (math)
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001257
definition: A function is a process or a relation that associates each element x of a set X, the domain of the function, to a single element y of another set Y (possibly the same set), the codomain of the function. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: realizable entity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000017
definition: To say that b is a realizable entity is to say that b is a specifically dependent continuant that inheres in some independent continuant which is not a spatial region and is of a type instances of which are realized in processes of a correlated type.´[BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: requirement
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001872
definition: A requirement is a proposition that states a set of conditions that have to be fulfilled to achieve some specific objective. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: continuant
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000002
definition: A continuant is an entity that persists, endures, or continues to exist through time while maintaining its identity. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: state
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0003374
definition: A state is a homomeric, cumulative process in which all the temporal parts are described by the same expression used for the whole. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.label: statistic datum role
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/rol.name: AFRL_0000328
definition: A statistic datum is the summary output of descriptive statistics on a statistical population. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: independent continuant
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000004
definition: b is an independent continuant if b is a continuant which is such that there is no c and no t such that b s-depends_on c at t. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: spatial region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000006
definition: A spatial region is a continuant entity that is a continuant part of space R as defined relative to some frame R. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: entity
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000001
definition: An entity is anything that exists or has existed or will exist. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: temporal region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000008
definition: A temporal region is an occurrent entity that is part of time as defined relative to some reference frame. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: spatiotemporal region
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000011
definition: A spatiotemporal region is an occurrent entity that is part of spacetime. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: specifically dependent continuant
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000020
definition: b is a specifically dependent continuant if b is a continuant and there is some independent continuant c which is not a spatial region and which is such that b specifically depends on c at every time t during the course of b’s existence. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: generically dependent continuant
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000031
definition: b is a generically dependent continuant if b is a continuant that generically depends on one or more other entities. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: role
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000023
definition: B is a role means: b is a realizable entity and b exists because there is some single bearer that is in some special physical, social, or institutional set of circumstances in which this bearer does not have to be and b is not such that, if it ceases to exist, then the physical make-up of the bearer is thereby changed. [BFO]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: disposition
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000016
definition: B is a disposition means: b is a realizable entity and b’s bearer is some material entity and b is such that if it ceases to exist, then its bearer is physically changed, and b’s realization occurs when and because this bearer is in some special physical circumstances, and this realization occurs in virtue of the bearer’s physical make-up. [BFO]

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Conc.label: Concept Scheme
http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Conc.name: ConceptScheme
definition: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Coll.label: Collection
http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Coll.name: Collection
definition: A meaningful collection of concepts.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Orde.label: Ordered Collection
http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#Orde.name: OrderedCollection
definition: An ordered collection of concepts, where both the grouping and the ordering are meaningful.

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: tensor datum
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0000958
definition: In mathematics, tensors are geometric objects that describe linear relations between geometric vectors, scalars, and other tensors. Elementary examples of such relations include the dot product, the cross product, and linear maps. The tensor datum is a facet that uses a tensor as an abstract mathematical description. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: codelist
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000036
definition: A set of codes in a controlled vocabulary. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: registry
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001059
definition: A registry is information content entity that is an aggregate of designations. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_00000.label: symbol
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/IAO_00000.name: IAO_0000028
definition: An information content entity that is a mark(s) or character(s) used as a conventional representation of another entity. [IAO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: and condition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000091
definition: An and condition is a collection of conditions that is valid if all condition items of it are valid. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: or condition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000092
definition: An or condition is a collection of conditions that is valid if at least one of its condition items is valid. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: one of condition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000093
definition: A one of condition is a collection of conditions that is valid if exactly one of its condition items is valid. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: list
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000160
definition: A list is an ordered collection of items. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: list item
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000161
definition: An entry in a list. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: series
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000162
definition: A series is a list (ordered collection) of literal values. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: series item
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000163
definition: An individual entry in a series with an index and a numeric value. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: mathematical object
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001054
definition: A mathematical object is an information content entity that is an abstraction in the area of mathematics. It has a formal definition that allows for deductive reasoning and mathematical proofs. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.label: set
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/com.name: AFC_0000168
definition: A collection where each member is disjoint from another. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion source
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000004
definition: A ion source is a device that has the function to produce or provide ions. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000354
definition: A device is an artifact that is designed to perform a function primarily by means of its mechanical or electrical nature. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to provision
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000137
definition: To accumulate or provide a material or energy flow. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to produce
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000196
definition: The function to bring something into existence. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: plumbing equipment
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000014
definition: Plumbing equipment are devices used as components of a plumbing system. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: plumbing system
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002153
definition: Plumbing is the system of pipes, tubing, drains, fittings, valves, and fixtures installed for the distribution of a liquid. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: sample passage
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000022
definition: A sample passage is the compartment of a device that handles the conveying of samples. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: compartment
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000322
definition: A separate enclosed physical section of a device that can contain other devices. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: calorimeter
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000023
definition: A piece of apparatus that is used to measure the heat of chemical reactions or physical changes. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: measurement device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002145
definition: A device that measures some aspect of reality, such as a quality or the profile of a process. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: gas chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000024
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a gas supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column, detector and a data acquisition/processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000392
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a mobile phase supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column, detector and a data acquisition/processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: gas chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000310
definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a gas. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: well plate
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000029
definition: A plate is a tray with multiple "wells" used as small test tubes. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: tray
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002231
definition: A tray is a shallow, flat container. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: mass-to-charge analyzer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000038
definition: A mass-to-charge analyzer is a separation device that separates ionized masses by their mass to charge ratio. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: separation device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002157
definition: A device that has the function to separate materials. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: barcode reader
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000040
definition: A barcode reader (or barcode scanner) is an electronic device for reading printed barcodes. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: input device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002156
definition: A device that is used to provide data and control signals to an information processing system. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: anode
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000049
definition: The anode is the electrode that acts as positive pole if voltage is applied (place of oxidation). [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electrode
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000422
definition: An electrode is an electrically-conducting device that exchanges electrons with an electrolyte as part of an electrical circuit. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: cathode
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000532
definition: The cathode is the electrode that acts as negative pole if voltage is applied (place of reduction). [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: autosampler
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000073
definition: A piece of equipment that allows for automated sampling or sample loading. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: sampler
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001711
definition: A sample is a device that function to sample known amounts of material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: device system
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000074
definition: An artificial system that is mainly composed of devices. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: artificial system
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002158
definition: A system that is created for a specific purpose. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: capillary column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000078
definition: A piece of apparatus that has the form of a tube with a diameter of less than a millimeter and hosts the stationary bed in chromatography. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: chromatography column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000217
definition: A chromatography column is a type of column that contains a stationary phase for chromatographic separation of compounds. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electrochemical coulometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000085
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an electrolytic cell, that is used to determine electric charge by measuring the amount of an element deposited or released at the cathode during a specified time. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: coulometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000855
definition: Any piece of apparatus used to measure electric charge. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: fraction collector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000088
definition: A fraction collector is a collecting device for recovering fractional volumes of the column effluent. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: collecting device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002172
definition: A collecting device is a device that has the function to collect things. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: diode array detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000090
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a two-dimensional pattern of diodes and a prism, that is used to detect organic compounds. As the sample passes through a cell or cuvette it is illuminated with light in the region 190-1100 nm and any light transmitted through the sample is dispersed by the prism, so that light of different wavelengths falls on different diodes. The output from the array is used to construct an absorption spectrum that can be compared with standard spectra for identification purposes. Alternatively, a single diode can be used to monitor a specific wavelength at which there is maximum absorption. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000317
definition: Any piece of apparatus used to detect an analyte. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electronic absorbance detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000734
definition: An electronic absorbance detector is a  detector that detects material by way of the electronic absorbance of a electromagnetic ray transmitted through the material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: liquid chromatography detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002200
definition: A liquid chromatography detector is a detector that is used in liquid chromatography as component of a LC system. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electromagnetic radiation source
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000097
definition: A source of a range of electromagnetic waves. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: radiation source
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002250
definition: A radiation source is a device that produces radiation used in a process. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: flow cell
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000105
definition: A flow cell is a measurement chamber that allows the sample to flow through. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: measurement chamber
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000646
definition: A measurement chamber is a closed space that contains the sample for measurement. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: Karl-Fischer coulometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000107
definition: A Karl-Fischer coulometer is a piece of apparatus, consisting of an electrolytic cell with an anodic compartment containing sulfur dioxide (SO2), iodide and a cathodic compartment containing the sample, which is used to determine trace amounts of water in a sample by measuring the time and current flow required to reach the titration end-point. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: porous-layer open-tubular column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000112
definition: An open-tubular column in which a porous layer, achieved by either etching a non-porous layer or by deposition of porous particles from a suspension, coats the inner wall and may serve as a support for a liquid stationary phase or as the stationary phase itself. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: open-tubular column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000691
definition: A chromatography column in which either the inner tube wall or a liquid or active solid held stationary on the tube wall acts as the stationary phase and there is an open, unrestricted path for the mobile phase. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: skimmer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000114
definition: A skimmer is a cone with a central orifice that intercepts the center of a spray or jet expansion to sample the central portion of the expansion, for example, as in a momentum separator. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion optics
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000753
definition: Devices designed to control the formation, focusing, and deflection of charged particle beams in a vacuum under the influence of electric and magnetic fields. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: optical microscope
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000129
definition: An optical microscope is a microscope that is consisting of an eyepiece, an objective lens, object turret, stage, and light source, which collects electromagnetic radiation in the visible range. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: microscope
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000825
definition: A microscope is a device which is used to visually magnify a specimen. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: optical device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001745
definition: An optical device is a device that creates, manipulates, or measures electromagnetic radiation. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: optical microscopy
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0001404
definition: A type of microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with visible light and a system of lenses is used to produce an image. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: analytical column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000135
definition: A chromatography column used for analysis. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: overhead stirrer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000139
definition: An overhead stirrer is a stirrer that is made up of a stirring rod with a paddle, anchor or propeller end that is driven by an overhead motor on a stand. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: stirrer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000812
definition: A stirrer is a mixing device used for stirring something. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: channel (communication)
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000145
definition: A communication channel or channel, refers either to a physical transmission medium such as a wire, or to a logical connection over a multiplexed medium such as a radio channel. A channel is used to convey an information signal, for example a digital bit stream, from one or several senders (or transmitters) to one or several receivers. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: communication device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002235
definition: A communication device is a device that has the function to communicate (transport information). [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: reactor
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000153
definition: A reactor is a container for controlling a biological or chemical reaction or process. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: open chromatographic bed
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000158
definition: A piece of apparatus that is planar and is or hosts the stationary bed in chromatography. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: gas chromatograph inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000161
definition: An inlet into a gas chromatograph. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: injection device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000266
definition: A device that introduces objects into the inside of another object. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: sample inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000462
definition: A sample inlet is an in port of a measurement or separation device where sample material is passing in to the device. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ultra high-performance liquid chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000171
definition: Liquid chromatograph that implements the ultra high-performance liquid chromatography. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: high-performance liquid chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000224
definition: A high-performance liquid chromatograph is an instrument used for HPLC that is a technique in analytical chemistry used to separate the components in a mixture, to identify each component, and to quantify each component. It has pumps to pass a pressurized liquid solvent containing the sample mixture through a column filled with a solid adsorbent material. Each component in the sample interacts slightly differently with the adsorbent material, causing different flow rates for the different components and leading to the separation of the components as they flow out the column. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: ultra high-performance liquid chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0002059
definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small (< 2 µm) particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: spectrophotometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000185
definition: A spectrophotometer is a photometer that measures the intensity of light at each individual wavelength. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: photometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001515
definition: A photometer, generally, is an instrument that measures light intensity or optical properties of solutions or surfaces. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: stir bar
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000199
definition: A stir bar is a small magnetic bar used in a magnetic stirrer. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: magnetic stirrer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000374
definition: A magnetic stirrer or magnetic mixer is a laboratory device that employs a rotating magnetic field to cause a stir bar (also called "flea") immersed in a liquid to spin very quickly, thus stirring it. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: analytical balance
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000201
definition: An analytical balance has a capacity of 50 - 200 g with a precision of 0.01 - 0.05 mg. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: balance
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000693
definition: A balance is a weighing device, intended predominantly for medium to low capacity weighments, with moderate to high resolutions, mostly used indoors. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: flame ionization detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000209
definition: A flame ionization detector is a measurement component that measures an analyte in a gas stream through the measurement of ions created via flame ionization. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: measurement component
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002185
definition: A measurement component is a component of a measuring system, that does measuring. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: gas chromatography detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002188
definition: A gas chromatography detector is a detector that is used in gas chromatography as component of a GC system. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: flame ionization measurement
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000142
definition: A flame ionization measurement is a measurement which is sensitive to compounds containing C-H bonds. A flow of carrier gas containing the sample is mixed with H2 and air and ignited. Any positively-charged radicals resulting from this process are collected at a cathode, allowing the current to be measured. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0001321
definition: A chromatography is a separation where the components are distributed between two phases, one of which is stationary, while the other moves in a definite direction. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electron ionization source
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000223
definition: An electron ionization source is an ion source that consists of an ionization chamber and a thin strip of metal that is heated electrically to incandescence or a temperature at which it emits free electrons that are accelerated through a potential to an energy where they ionize the sample. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: liquid chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000808
definition: A liquid chromatograph is a system used to perform bioseparation techniques that are based on interactions of the sample with the mobile and stationary phases. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: high-performance liquid chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000748
definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid, the stationary phase consists of very small particles and the inlet pressure is relatively high. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: high-performance liquid chromatography column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000231
definition: A chromatography column that contains very small particles and is capable of taking a high inlet pressure. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: chromatographic detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000246
definition: A chromatography detector is a detector that is used in chromatography as component of a chromatography system. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: weighing device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000252
definition: A weighing device is a measurement device for measuring mass by the gravitational force on earth. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: mass
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001844
definition: A mass datum is a quality quantification facet that quantifies some amount of matter. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: measuring
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0002294
definition: Measuring is observing a property of an entity called a quantity, that has a magnitude that can be expressed as a number and a reference to another entity, and obtaining one or more quantity values for it. The observed entity is a quality or a disposition for a continuant, for a process it is a process property such as duration. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: transferring device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002168
definition: A transferring device is a device that is designed to transfer material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to inject
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000030
definition: The function of a device realized when administering a substance applied particularly to the forcible insertion of a liquid or gas by means of a syringe, pump, etc. [OBI]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: strong anion-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000277
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a strong anion exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: anion-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000550
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an anion exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: homogenizer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000299
definition: A homogenizer is a device used for homogenization of various types of material. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: shaping device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002228
definition: A shaping device is a conversion device that alters the shape of some material. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: weak anion-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000301
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a weak anion exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: support-coated open-tubular column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000307
definition: An open-tubular column in which a layer of porous particles deposited from a suspension coats the inner wall and serves as a support for a liquid stationary phase. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: thermal conductivity detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000316
definition: A thermal conductivity detector is a measurement component that measures changes in the thermal conductivity of the column effluent and compares it to a reference flow of carrier gas. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: thermal conductivity measurement
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0002206
definition: A measuring that is sensitive to inorganic gases. A hot (450 deg. C) filament is used to heat a carrier gas containing the sample and the difference in thermal conductivity caused by the presence of the sample is measured. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: observation device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002242
definition: An observation device is a device that has the function to observe something. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to detect
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000037
definition: To discover information about the presence of a flow. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: device region
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001028
definition: A site that is related to a device. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/spa.label: space
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/spa.name: AFSP_0000005
definition: A space is a site that can be occupied or where something can be done. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/spa.label: section (site)
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/spa.name: AFSP_0000007
definition: A section is a site that is a more or less distinct part of a site into which the site is divided. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: pressure sensor
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000327
definition: A sensor that measures the pressure. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: sensor
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002184
definition: A sensor is a component of a measuring system that is directly affected by a phenomenon, body, or substance carrying a quantity to be measured. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: vial
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000329
definition: A vial is a small vessel or bottle. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: capillary
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000340
definition: A capillary is a tube with a small diameter. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: tube
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000718
definition: A tube, or tubing, is a long hollow cylinder used for moving fluids (liquids or gases) or to protect electrical or optical cables and wires. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: temperature controlled chamber
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000350
definition: A temperature controlled chamber is a chamber or enclosed space in which a temperature can be controlled and set to a specific value. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: artifact
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002099
definition: An artifact is a material that is designed and built for a purpose. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: strong cation-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000360
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a strong cation exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: cation-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000523
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a cation exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: refractive index detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000363
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source, a hollow prism and a photoelectric cell that is used to detect non-ultraviolet-absorbing molecules in a sample separated by chromatography. Light from the sample passes through a flow cell with two channels towards the photoelectric cell. One channel holds the eluent from the column, whereas the other holds a control sample (solvent that has not passed through the column).  Detection occurs when the light is bent due to molecules eluting from the column, and this is read as a disparity between the two channels. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electrolytic conductivity detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000368
definition: A conductivity probe to calculate the conductance value of a material at the selected reference temperature. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: chemical ionization source
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000370
definition: A chemical ionization source is an ion source that consists of a high-pressure ionization chamber containing a reagent gas (for example N2, O2 or H2O) which is ionized by high-energy electrons from a heated strip of metal and goes on to react with the analyte to ionize it. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: reservoir
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000378
definition: The reservoir is a container that stores solutions. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to contain
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000139
definition: To keep a flow within limits. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: thermometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000410
definition: A thermometer is a device that measures temperature or a temperature gradient. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: temperature
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0001584
definition: A temperature (datum) is a quantity facet that quantifies some temperature. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ultraviolet-visible spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000421
definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the range ultraviolet to visible (190--800 nm). [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: guard column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000430
definition: A short protective chromatography column used to protect the main analytical column from damaging impurities that are injected into the instrument. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: gel filtration chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000431
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of an eluent supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column containing a swollen gel, a detector and a data acquisition/processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: in port
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002190
definition: An in port is a port in a device where material is flowing into the system boundary. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: optical spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000466
definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure a spectrum by illumination with light. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000857
definition: A piece of apparatus used to measure a spectrum. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: damper
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000471
definition: A damper is an inhibition device that deadens, restrains, or depresses. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: inhibition device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002254
definition: An inhibition device is a device that has the function to inhibit flows (material, energy, information). A part of the flow is passing through the device. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: pump
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000499
definition: A pump is a device that is used to pump. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000803
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is an ion exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: cell counter
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000524
definition: A device used to count the number of cells present in known volume of sample to determine the overall concentration cells per unit volume. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: cell counter assay
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000032
definition: Cell counter assay is a cellular assay that uses various methods to quantify cells in a culture. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: quadrupole mass spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000527
definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of an ion source, a mass-to-charge analyzer, a detector and a vacuum system and is used to measure mass spectra. The detector is a quadrupole mass-to-charge analyzer, which holds the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: mass spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000648
definition: A mass spectrometer is a measurement device that measures the m/z values and abundances of gas-phase ions. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: temperature controller
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000528
definition: A device used to control the temperature in a compartment. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: controller
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002148
definition: A device that has the function to control some quality or process. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electron capture detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000534
definition: An electron capture detector is a measurement component that measures an analyte in a gas stream through the attachment of electrons via electron capture ionization. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: electron capture measurement
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0001113
definition: Electron capture measurement is a measurement that is sensitive to electronegative compounds (e.g. halogenated compounds). A beta-particle emitter (e.g. 63Ni) is used to produce an electron beam, which is passed between two electrodes. As the sample is passed through the e-beam, organic functional groups interact with the electrons, interrupting the current. [Allotrope, CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: vial rack
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000540
definition: A vial rack is a tray capable of holding multiple vials within a defined layout. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: vial container
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002278
definition: A vial container is a container that has the function to contain vials. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: Paul ion trap
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000541
definition: Ion trapping device that depends on the application of radio frequency potentials between a ring electrode and two end-cap electrodes to confine the ion motion to a cyclic path described by an appropriate form of the Mathieu equation. The choice of these potentials determines the m/z value below which ions are not trapped. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion trap
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000625
definition: A ion trap is a device for spatially confining ions using electric and magnetic fields alone or in combination. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: Raman spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000551
definition: A Raman spectrometer is a piece of apparatus that allows for the measurement of Raman spectra. It consists of a laser and a detector. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ultraviolet spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000554
definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the ultraviolet range (190-400 nm). [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: data acquisition device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000555
definition: A device to acquire signals or data. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: data acquisition
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0003095
definition: Data acquisition is the process of sampling signals that measure real world physical conditions and converting the resulting samples into digital numeric values that can be manipulated by a computer. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: splitter
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000558
definition: A device used to split a fluid into two component streams. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: distribution device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002193
definition: A distribution device is a device with the function to distribute a stream into multiple parts. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: fluorescence detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000567
definition: A fluorescence detector is a detector that detects material by way of the measurement of the emitted fluorescence light after excitation with light. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: fluorimetry
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0002788
definition: An assay in which a materials fluorescence is determined. [VIVO-ISF]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: blood gas analyzer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000574
definition: A blood gas analyzer is a device that is used for blood gas measurement. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: blood gas analysis
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0001047
definition: Blood gas analysis is the process of analyzing amount of dissolved gases in a blood sample. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: capillary electrophoresis column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000579
definition: A capillary electrophoresis column is a type of column that is used in capillary electrophoresis. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: degasser
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000587
definition: A degasser is a device to remove gasses from a fluid which could otherwise form bubbles. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: degassing
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000593
definition: Degassing is a sample preparation process whereby the adsorbed (dissolved) gas is removed from a solid or liquid. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to remove
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000108
definition: To take away a part of a flow from its prefixed place. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000642
definition: A piece of apparatus that produces an output that depends on the number of ions that it encounters. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: electrospray inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000669
definition: Inlet used for introducing the liquid sample into an electrospray ionization source. [PSI/MS]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ion source inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000771
definition: An ion source inlet is an inlet into an ion source of a mass spectrometer. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: supercritical-fluid chromatograph
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000673
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a mobile phase supply system, an injection or sampling system, a column, detector and a data acquisition/processing system, that is used to carry out chromatographic separations where the mobile phase is a fluid above and relatively close to tits critical temperature and pressure. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: supercritical-fluid chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000253
definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a fluid above and relatively close to its critical temperature and pressure. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: packed column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000692
definition: A chromatography column that contains a solid packing. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ultraviolet detector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000711
definition: A piece of apparatus, consisting of a light source, a photoelectric cell, a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light, which is used to detect the absorbance of ultraviolet (190-400 nm) light by molecules in a sample separated by chromatography. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: differential scanning calorimeter
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000733
definition: A device that is used to measure the heat of chemical reactions or physical changes for both a sample and a reference. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: electronic absorbance measurement
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0002188
definition: Electronic absorption measurement is a measurement that is based on the absorption of energy by electronic transitions. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: array column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000742
definition: An array column is a column that contains multiple columns at the same time. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: syringe
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000746
definition: A syringe is an injection device that is a simple pump consisting of a plunger that fits tightly in a tube. The plunger can be pulled and pushed along inside a cylindrical tube (called a barrel), allowing the syringe to take in and expel a liquid or gas through an orifice at the open end of the tube. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: splitless inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000755
definition: A splitless inlet is a gas chromatograph inlet enabling the carrier gas to sweep the volatilized sample onto the GC column. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: display
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000761
definition: A display is a device or element of an instrument serving to represent information. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to display
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000052
definition: To reveal something about a flow to the mind or eye. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: weak cation-exchange column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000775
definition: A chromatography column where the stationary phase is a weak cation exchanger. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: single quadrupole mass spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000776
definition: A single quadrupole mass spectrometer is a type of quadrupole mass spectrometer that uses one single quadrupole field. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: wall-coated open-tubular column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000779
definition: An open-tubular column in which the liquid stationary phase is coated on the unmodified smooth inner wall of the tube. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: cooling device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000785
definition: A kind of heat exchanger or radiator designed to remove excess heat. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to cool
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000089
definition: A function to remove thermal energy. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: valve
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000795
definition: A valve is a plumbing equipment that regulates, directs or controls the flow of a fluid (gases, liquids, fluidized solids, or slurries) by opening, closing, or partially obstructing various passageways. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: ultraviolet-visible-near infrared spectrometer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000800
definition: A piece of apparatus that consists of: a light source; a holder for the sample; a diffraction grating or monochromator to separate the different wavelengths of light; a detector, and is used to measure spectra in the range ultraviolet to near-infrared (190--2000 nm) resulting in electronic transitions within the sample. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: liquid chromatography
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000225
definition: Column chromatography where the mobile phase is a liquid. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: split inlet
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000811
definition: A split inlet is a gas chromatograph inlet followed by a splitter enabling the carrier gas to sweep a part of volatilized sample onto the GC column, with that remaining split/swept to waste. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: agitator
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001265
definition: An agitator is a device or mechanism to put something into motion. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: mixer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001266
definition: A mixer is a device used for mixing. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to stir
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000205
definition: To stir is a mixing function involving the agitation of a solution through circular motion. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: oven
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000816
definition: An oven is a device for heating an enclosed space. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: heating device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001128
definition: A device used for heating something. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.label: microscopy
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/pro.name: AFP_0000044
definition: Microscopy is a imaging assay where a microscope is used to view a small object (or specimen) by producing a magnified image. [CHMO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: solvent channel
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000828
definition: A solvent channel is a channel where a liquid can flow through. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: coupling device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002151
definition: A device that has the function to couple things. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to link
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000121
definition: To couple flows together by means of an intermediary flow. [NIST]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: fiat object part
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000024
definition: B is a fiat object part if b is a material entity which is such that for all times t, if b exists at t then there is some object c such that b is a proper continuant part of c at t and c is demarcated from the remainder of c by a two-dimensional continuant fiat boundary. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.label: electric charge
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/res.name: AFR_0002111
definition: Electric charge is the quality quantification facet that quantifies the integral of electric current over time. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: titrator
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000876
definition: A titrator is a device that automates titrations. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: slit
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0000986
definition: A long narrow cut or opening. [Allotrope]

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.label: site
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BFO_00000.name: BFO_0000029
definition: B is a site means: b is a three-dimensional immaterial entity that is (partially or wholly) bounded by a material entity or it is a three-dimensional immaterial part thereof. [BFO]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: quadrupole
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001045
definition: A quadrupole is a mass-to-charge analyzer that holds the ions in a stable orbit by an electric field generated by four parallel electrodes. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: bath
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001121
definition: A vessel used for regulating the temperature of something placed within it. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to heat
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000044
definition: A function that gives thermal energy to a recipient. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: connecting device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002227
definition: A connecting device is a device that has the function to connect things. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to mix
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000119
definition: To combine two flows (material, energy, signal) into a single, uniform homogeneous mass. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: jar
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001410
definition: Jars are cylindrical containers with wide openings that may be sealed. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: controlled lab reactor
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001519
definition: A controlled lab reactor is a reactor that maintains temperature and other reaction parameters and has measuring devices. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: differential scanning calorimetry pan
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001622
definition: A differential scanning calorimetry pan is a pan for use in a differential scanning calorimeter that contains the sample under investigation. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: pan
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001623
definition: A pan is a flat container. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: mass flow controller
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001671
definition: A mass flow controller is a device that determines the mixture of different materials. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: computer
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001695
definition: A computer is a general-purpose device that can be programmed to carry out a set of arithmetic or logical operations automatically. Since a sequence of operations can be readily changed, the computer can solve more than one kind of problem. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: pressure regulator
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001703
definition: A pressure regulator is a controller that regulates a set pressure in a system. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to sample
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000201
definition: To sample is the function of to take parts or partitions of an object aggregate or data set for the interest for studying it. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: tablet press
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001718
definition: A tablet press is a mechanical device that compresses powder into tablets of uniform size and weight. To form a tablet, the granulated material must be metered into a cavity formed by two punches and a die, and then the punches must be pressed together to a set separation distance to allow the powder / granule to transform into a solid compact through compression. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: compression device
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0002256
definition: A compression device is a device that is designed to compress to volume of material by applying force. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: cell holder
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001747
definition: A cell holder is a type of container for samples in spectrophotometers. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: excimer lamp
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001754
definition: An excimer lamp is a light source of ultraviolet light produced by spontaneous emission of excimer (exciplex) molecules. [Wikipedia]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: UV lamp
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001755
definition: A UV lamp is a light source with an ultraviolet wavelength range of 190 to 380 nm. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: lamp
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001875
definition: A lamp is an electromagnetic radiation source of incoherent radiation. [IUPAC]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: tubing connector
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001761
definition: A tubing connector is a part used to connect/install tubing, components, and accessories as part of a system flow path configuration. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.label: to join
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/fun.name: AFFN_0000122
definition: To couple flows together in a predetermined manner. [NIST]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: spin column
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001763
definition: A spin column is a column used for concentration of biological samples containing membranes for ultrafiltration. The solid phase is made up of silica to which the biological sample binds. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: visible lamp
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001771
definition: A visible lamp is a light source with a visible wavelength range of 380 to 780 nm. [Allotrope]

http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.label: deuterium lamp
http://purl.allotrope.org/ontologies/equ.name: AFE_0001772
definition: A deuterium lamp is a low-pressure gas-discharge light source that emits light with a continuous spectrum mainly in the ultraviolet region. [Wikipedia]
